SENT.plain: The association between systemic lupus erythematosus and antiphospholipid syndrome can cause several complications
We report a 45 years old woman, treated with steroids for a systemic lupus erythematosus
She presented with a clinical picture of a lupus pneumonitis and, subsequently, with the picture of a pulmonary thromboembolism
The diagnosis was confirmed by helicoidal computed axial tomography
The patient was treated with anticoagulants, with a favourable outcome
